options.text: Enterprise-Scale ARM deployment requires access at the tenant root (/) scope. Visit this link to ensure you have the appropriate RBAC permission to complete the deployment

options.text: To enable platform management, security and governance, you must allocate a management Subscription. Please note, this Subscription will be moved to the platform Management Group, and ARM will deploy a Log Analytics workspace and requisite settings. We recommend using a new Subscription with no existing resources. Note that Azure Policy will be used to govern the configuration for the platform at scale.

options.text: Enterprise-Scale provides an integrated CICD pipeline via AzOps that can be used with either GitHub Actions or Azure DevOps pipelines.

Enterprise-Scale provides an integrated CICD pipeline via AzOps that can be used with either GitHub Actions or Azure DevOps pipelines, but requires a dedicated subscription for platform management in the previous step. Please add a subscription or continue without setting up the CICD integration.
Provide the credentials to initialize the repository with the ARM templates for Enterprise-Scale.

elements.name: optionsGroup1
elements.label: Select CICD option
elements.toolTip: Enterprise-Scale will provide options for both GitHub Actions and Azure DevOps pipelines. For now, only GitHub Actions is available

elements.name: esGit
elements.label: GitHub organization or username
elements.toolTip: Provide Git org/username.

elements.name: esGitRepoName
elements.label: New GitHub repository name
elements.toolTip: Provide a name for the new repository that will be created

elements.name: esPaToken
elements.toolTip: Provide the personal access token to access your GitHub account or organization. For more information see this link: https://docs.github.com/en/github/authenticating-to-github/creating-a-personal-access-token

constraints.validationMessage: Password must be at least 8 characters long, contain only numbers and letters

toolTip.password: Provide the application secret as it will be used to authenticate with Azure AD

options.text: To enable Hub & Spoke connectivity, you must allocate a connectivity Subscription. Please note, this Subscription will be moved to the connectivity Management Group, and ARM will deploy the first networking hub and requisite settings. We recommend using a new Subscription with no existing resources.

elements.name: esHub
elements.label: Deploy virtual hub network
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected when also adding a subscription for connectivity, ARM will deploy virtual network for hub

elements.name: esAddressHub
elements.label: Address space (required for hub virtual hub)
elements.toolTip: Provide address prefix in CIDR notation (e.g 10.100.0.0/16)

constraints.validationMessage: The virtual hubs network's address space, specified as one address prefixes in CIDR notation (e.g. 192.168.1.0/24)

elements.name: esNwLocation
elements.label: Region for the first virtual network hub
elements.toolTip: Select the target region for you connectivity deployment (requires you to provide a subscriptionId for connectivity)

elements.name: esDdoS
elements.label: Enable DDoS Protection Standard
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected when also adding a connectivity subscription, DDoS Protection Standard will be enabled.

elements.name: esVpnGw
elements.label: Deploy VPN Gateway
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected when also adding a subscription for connectivity, ARM will deploy VPN gateway

elements.name: esGwOrErAz
elements.label: Select Availability Zones for the Virtual Network Gateway/ExpressRoute Gateway
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected when also adding a subscription for connectivity, ARM will deploy Virtual Gateway/Express Route Gateway to the selected region and availability zones.

elements.name: esVpnGwType
elements.label: Select VPN type
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected when also adding a subscription for connectivity, ARM will deploy VPN gateway. Select whether it should be policy or route based.

elements.name: esAddressVpnOrEr
elements.label: Subnet for VPN/ExpressRoute Gateways
elements.toolTip: Provide address prefix in CIDR notation (e.g 10.100.1.0/24)

constraints.validationMessage: The subnet network's address space, specified as one address prefixes in CIDR notation (e.g. 192.168.1.0/24)

elements.name: esErGw
elements.label: Deploy ExpressRoute Gateway
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected when also adding a subscription for connectivity, ARM will deploy Express Route gateway

elements.name: esAzFw

elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected when also adding a subscription for connectivity, ARM will deploy Azure Firewall

elements.name: esFwAz

elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected when also adding a subscription for connectivity, ARM will deploy Azure Firewall to the selected region and availability zones.

elements.name: esAddressFw

options.text: To enable identity (AuthN/AuthZ) for workloads in landing zones, you must allocate an identity Subscription that is dedicated to host your Active Directory domain controllers. Please note, this Subscription will be moved to the identity Management Group, and ARM will assign the selected policies. We recommend using a new Subscription with no existing resources.

elements.name: esIdentity
elements.label: Enable identity subscription
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected when also adding a subscription for connectivity, ARM will move selected subscription into identity management group

options.text: Select which of the the recommended policies you will assign to your identity management group.

elements.name: esIdDenyRdp
elements.label: Prevent inbound RDP from internet
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Policy will be assigned and prevent inbound RDP from internet

elements.name: esIdDenySubnetNsg
elements.label: Ensure subnets are associated with NSG
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Policy will be assigned to ensure NSGs must be associated with subnets being created

elements.name: esIdDenyPublicIp
elements.label: Prevent usage of public IP
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Policy will be assigned to ensure public IP resources cannot be created

elements.name: esIdAzBackup
elements.label: Ensure Azure VMs (Windows & Linux) are enabled for Azure Backup
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Policy will be assigned and enable Azure Backup on all VMs in the landing zones.

options.text: You can optionally provide subscriptions for your first landing zones for both 'online' and 'corp' and assign recommended policies that will ensure workloads will be secure, monitored, and protected according to best practices.
Select the subscriptions you want to move to corp management group.

elements.name: esLzConnectivity
elements.label: Connect corp landing zones to the connectivity hub (optional)?
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected for corp landing zones, ARM will connect the subscriptions to the hub virtual network via VNet peering.

elements.name: lzConnectedSubs
elements.ariaLabel: Add existing subscriptions into the management group landing zone and provide address space for virtual network peering
elements.label: Corp connected landing zone subscriptions (optional)

element.placeholder: Ensure there are no overlapping IP addresses!

validations.message: Only alphanumeric characters are allowed, and the value must be 1-30 characters long.

options.text: Select the subscriptions you want to move to online management group.
Select which of the the recommended policies you will assign to your landing zones.

elements.name: esLzDdoS
elements.label: Enable DDoS Protection Standard
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected when also adding a connectivity subscription earlier, DDoS Protection Standard will be enabled.

elements.name: esLzPrivateLink
elements.label: Prevent usage of Public Endpoints for PaaS services in the corp connected landing zones
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected then Azure Policy will prevent PaaS resources to use public endpoints.

elements.name: esEncryptionInTransit
elements.label: Ensure encryption in transit is enabled for PaaS services
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected then Azure Policy will ensure PaaS resources uses TLS and SSL.

elements.name: esVmMonitoring
elements.label: Ensure Azure VMs (Windows & Linux) are being monitored
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected when also adding a subscription for management, ARM will deploy resources and enable them for continous compliance

elements.name: esVmssMonitoring
elements.label: Ensure Azure VMSS (Windows & Linux) are being monitored
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected when also adding a subscription for management, ARM will deploy resources and enable them for continous compliance

elements.name: esArcVmMonitoring
elements.label: Ensure Azure Arc VMs (Windows & Linux) are being monitored
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected when also adding a subscription for management, ARM will deploy resources and enable them for continous compliance

elements.name: esAksPolicy
elements.label: Enable Kubernetes (AKS) for Azure Policy
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected when also adding a subscription for management, ARM will deploy resources and enable them for continous compliance

elements.name: esAksPriv
elements.label: Prevent privileged containers in Kubernetes clusters
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, policy will be assigned to prevent privileged containers in AKS

elements.name: esAksNoPriv
elements.label: Prevent privileged escalation in Kubernetes clusters
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, policy will be assigned to prevent privileged escalations in AKS

elements.name: esAksIngress
elements.label: Ensure HTTPS ingress is enforced in Kubernetes clusters
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, HTTPS ingress will be required in AKS

elements.name: esAzBackup
elements.label: Ensure Azure VMs (Windows & Linux) are enabled for Azure Backup
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Policy will be assigned and enable Azure Backup on all VMs in the landing zones.

elements.name: esDenyRdp

elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Policy will be assigned and prevent inbound RDP from internet

elements.name: esNsg

elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Policy will be assigned to ensure NSGs must be associated with subnets being created

elements.name: esIpForwarding

elements.name: esSqlEncryption

elements.name: esSqlAudit
elements.label: Ensure auditing is enabled on Azure SQL
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Policy will be assigned to ensure auditing is enabled on Azure SQLs

elements.name: esHttpsStorage
